alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 5:23PM EDT until June 25 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL CAMDEN...NORTH CENTRAL GLOUCESTER AND WEST CENTRAL BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 522 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lindenwold, or 9 miles southeast of Gloucester City, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Cherry Hill, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Voorhees, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Berlin, Magnolia, Woodbury Heights, Chesilhurst, Audubon Park, Barclay-Kingston, Cherry Hill Mall, Golden Triangle, Marlton, Erlton-Ellisburg, Greentree, Ramblewood, Echelon and Ashland. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 3 and 4. Interstate 76 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 38. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 42 and 44. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
